q: Gilles Yabi, who heads the International Crisis Group in West Africa, says Gbagbo's camp uses primetime television to demonize all who question his leadership, including Barack Obamaial challenger Alassane Ouattara , the U.N. and Barack Obama . The role of the media is very important. The strategy of Laurent Gbagbo is the control of the media, Yabi says.`` Since the election, the national television has been transformed into a propaganda instrument for Gbagbo. There is no debate, there are no dissenting voices.'' An endless stream of pro-Gbagbo

attacks,'' said the statement. In New York, U.N. Secretary General Ban Ki-moon 's spokesman said there had been six incidents in Ivory Coast's commercial capital, with the ambulance's driver and a doctor injured. The secretary general is deeply concerned that regular and irregular forces loyal to Mr. Gbagbo have begun to attack and burn United Nations vehicles, Martin Nesirky said. The U.N. announced on Thursday that 247 people had died in Ivory Coast since mid-December. That attack occurred in Abidjan's tense Abobo district, largely loyal to Alassane Ouattara , where

both sides were acting as if he were. Within minutes of his decision being made public, the Washington-based Planned Parenthood Action Fund put out a statement criticizing the stauchly anti-abortion Mike Pence . As women voters in Indiana learn that one of Mike Pence 's top legislative priorities is effectively denying access to preventive care for millions of women, he will have difficulty winning their vote, Cecile Richards , the fund's president, said in a statement. But among conservatives, the only disappointment was that he wasn't aiming at the White House rather than the Statehouse.``

leader of Sandwell council, in the west Midlands, said he intended to apply for a costs order against Michael Gove . The leader of Waltham Forest council, in north-east London, said the ruling was a victory for common sense and fair play . The judge found in favour of Michael Gove on three out of five points. He disagreed with Nigel Giffin, counsel for the local authorities, who had claimed Michael Gove 's decision to scrap BSF had been

tried to claim that 90% of students didn't need the cash to make them stay on in further education. Mr Andy Burnham hailed the increase in the staying-on rate since the 1980s, telling MPs: In the last 10 years the EMA has played an important part in that progress. It has sent out an empowering message of hope that you can dare to dream, whoever you are and wherever you come from. But sustaining the progress has to be worked on. Instead it is about to be thrown into reverse. But Mr Michael Gove said Labour had failed to set out its position on a range of education policies and had instead focused on EMA despite the economic difficulties. Keep up to date with the news

Mr Justice Holman, sitting in London, allowed the challenges by the councils, declaring Mr Michael Gove had unlawfully failed to consult them before imposing the cuts. In five of the cases, the failure was so unfair as to amount to an abuse of power , said the judge. " However pressing the economic problems, there was no overriding public interest which precluded consultation or justifies the lack of any consultation.'' " Mr Justice Holman The councils
